HERO.SLIDE3_SUBTITLE: Join top minds to shape future health

ABOUT.OVERVIEW_DESC: The Health Research Conference project aims to enhance scientific research culture in the health sector by providing a scientific platform that brings together researchers and experts to discuss the latest developments. It also aims to support emerging researchers by forming research teams that specifically target resident doctors, trainees, and other health specialties, then providing them with support and scientific supervision in all research stages; starting from idea generation, through study implementation, and ending with scientific publication within the conference that includes important events. The goal is to reach the largest possible segment of society for knowledge exchange, stimulating innovation, and creating an outstanding hackathon for ideas.
ABOUT.GOAL1_DESC: Enable participants to create research that starts with a simple idea and ends with impactful scientific publication, under academic supervision and professional follow-up.
ABOUT.GOAL2_DESC: Launch a research hackathon before the conference that ignites the spirit of challenge and enhances the platform for presentation and excellence among teams.
ABOUT.GOAL3: Build a New Generation of Research Leaders
ABOUT.GOAL3_DESC: Discover and nurture young research talents who lead sustainable scientific projects and face healthcare sector challenges.
ABOUT.GOAL4_DESC: Honor the best research, award prizes, and provide opportunities to present projects before scientific committees and specialized community.

VISION.VISION_DESC: For the project to be a leading platform that supports innovative health research with direct impact on the health sector.
VISION.VISION_DESC2: Leading the direction towards research innovations that create positive transformation in future health services.
VISION.MISSION_DESC: Enable researchers and health practitioners to develop their ideas and transform them into practical, beneficial projects.
VISION.MISSION_DESC2: Provide an integrated environment that includes guidance, partnerships, and the necessary infrastructure to enhance research quality.

AUDIENCE.TITLE: Target Audience
AUDIENCE.DESC: We target a diverse range of talents and competencies
AUDIENCE.CARD1_TITLE: Healthcare Practitioners (Doctors – Pharmacy – Nursing – Health Technicians)
AUDIENCE.CARD1_DESC: The project and hackathon provide them with the opportunity to contribute to presenting the real challenges they face in the health field, and participate in finding innovative research solutions that are applicable and developing the services provided.
AUDIENCE.CARD2_TITLE: Students in Health and Scientific Specialties
AUDIENCE.CARD2_DESC: The project targets ambitious students from all universities and graduate studies to develop their research and practical skills, and motivate them to participate in leading projects.
AUDIENCE.CARD3_TITLE: Health Institutions and Organizations Supporting Research and Innovation
AUDIENCE.CARD3_DESC: The project is an opportunity for strategic institutions to build successful research outputs and support them financially or logistically; ensuring investment in ideas and transforming them into initiatives or products that serve society and health.

IDENTITY.TITLE: Visual Identity
IDENTITY.SYMBOL_DESC: A visual element resembling an atom or electron orbits, representing research as the atom symbolizes fundamental sciences, technology, and innovation in health fields. It expresses the integration between disciplines and research collaboration through the intersection of orbits and their multiple axes.
IDENTITY.ADDRESS_DESC: The naming reflects an identity from Hail, where research and innovation come from the heart of health regions. The project combines scientific research with supporting partnerships to build an integrated system. The name Inceptia symbolizes the beginning built on scientific methodology, while HAIL connects identity to place and embodies the message of regional centrality moving towards impact.
IDENTITY.COLORS_DESC: Dark blue symbolizes innovation, growth, and reliability, reflecting the identity's orientation towards modern health fields with a scientific character. Green expresses vitality, optimism, and the advancement of health services.

PILLARS.TITLE: Project Pillars
PILLARS.SUBTITLE: The project aims to highlight the most prominent modern trends in health and research fields through specialized scientific pillars.
PILLARS.PILLAR1_DESC: Modern Medicine and Advanced Medical Technologies
PILLARS.PILLAR2: Artificial Intelligence in Medicine and Healthcare
PILLARS.PILLAR2_DESC: Digital Transformation in the Health Sector
PILLARS.PILLAR3: Innovation in Medical Education and Research

SCHEDULE.TITLE: Project Timeline
SCHEDULE.STAGE1_DESC: Implementation of research courses and workshops, formation of research groups and identification of research topics, preparation of proposals and submission to the Research Ethics Committee (IRB), and receiving feedback and selecting final projects.
SCHEDULE.STAGE2_DESC: Starting and collecting data completely, analyzing preliminary results of data, following up on analysis and complete data entry and preparing initial versions of research and progress plans.
SCHEDULE.STAGE3_DESC: Evaluating project impact and success indicators, preparing conference materials and team presentations, conducting final rehearsals for presentation and preparing for sessions.
SCHEDULE.STAGE4_DESC: An innovative and competitive event that brings together specialists in health fields, researchers, and students within diverse multidisciplinary teams to compete in producing innovative research models that are applicable.

TRACKS.TITLE: Tracks & Challenges
TRACKS.SUBTITLE: Eight main tracks you can compete in
TRACKS.TRACK1_DESC: AI-based solutions to improve diagnosis and decision support.
TRACKS.TRACK2_DESC: Digital learning and training platforms for healthcare practitioners.
TRACKS.TRACK3_DESC: Community prevention and early risk monitoring.
TRACKS.TRACK4_DESC: Mental health support applications and behavioral analytics.
TRACKS.TRACK5_DESC: Improving patient journey and service access.
TRACKS.TRACK7_DESC: Solutions focused on maternal and child health.

PARTICIPATE.TITLE: Hackathon Implementation Mechanism
PARTICIPATE.STEP1_DESC: A formal announcement about the hackathon is launched through approved channels such as the website and others, including all details regarding objectives, conditions, and research axes. After the announcement, an electronic registration period opens for interested researchers, doctors, students, and specialists, with the necessary forms available for filling out research team data and the fields they wish to participate in.
PARTICIPATE.STEP2_DESC: During the registration phase, initial research proposals are received from participating teams, where they are asked to submit their research idea or the health problem they intend to work on, clarifying the proposed research path and its preliminary objectives. These proposals are reviewed by a specialized committee to ensure their suitability for the specified tracks and to allow teams to receive feedback before the hackathon activities begin.
PARTICIPATE.STEP3_DESC: A specialized committee reviews all submitted proposals according to clear criteria such as: the idea's relevance to healthcare sector needs, applicability, and novelty. In this stage, proposals are screened, and the best ones are selected to proceed to the practical stages of the hackathon.
PARTICIPATE.STEP4_DESC: Research is presented before a specialized judging panel comprising experts in scientific research and health innovation to review the final models according to specific criteria. After comprehensive evaluation, the most distinguished and impactful research is identified, and winning teams are honored and awarded incentive prizes with the aim of enabling this research to continue and transform into practical projects serving the healthcare sector.

IMPACT.TITLE: Expected Impact
IMPACT.SECTION1_TITLE1: Establishing an Integrated Health Research and Innovation Center
IMPACT.SECTION1_DESC1: A permanent incubator for research ideas, providing technical, financial, and administrative support to transform outcomes into applicable projects.
IMPACT.SECTION1_TITLE2: Creating Agile Clinical Research Units within Hospitals
IMPACT.SECTION1_DESC2: Implementing research directly in a clinical environment, monitoring results with practitioners under the supervision of research ethics committees.
IMPACT.SECTION2_DESC1: Developing accredited programs for top healthcare and research professionals, including skills in research design, data analysis, and project management.
IMPACT.SECTION2_TITLE2: Enhancing the Conference and Hackathon as an Annual Platform
IMPACT.SECTION2_DESC2: Thanks to advanced results and success, we expect the project to become an annual event attracting more innovative minds and contributing to raising the level of health research and innovation.

REGISTRATION.TITLE: Register Now
REGISTRATION.SUBTITLE: Join the innovation journey in health
REGISTRATION.NAME: Name

REG_SIMPLE.TITLE: Register Your Interest
REG_SIMPLE.SUBTITLE: Leave your basic details and we'll contact you about relevant events and services.
REG_SIMPLE.SUBMIT_SUCCESS: Your registration has been submitted successfully! We will contact you soon.

PARTNERS.TITLE: Supporting Organizations & Partners
PARTNERS.SUBTITLE: We thank our partners for their support

ITEM1.Q: What language will be used in the hackathon?
ITEM1.A: Arabic is the primary language for communication and presentations. Technical materials in English are accepted when needed.

ITEM2.Q: Can I register the idea in Arabic or English?
ITEM2.A: Yes, ideas can be registered in Arabic or English, with a preference to unify the final presentation language.

ITEM3.Q: Can I register more than one idea?
ITEM3.A: You may submit multiple ideas, but you will need to select one to proceed with during the implementation phase.

ITEM4.Q: Can I register with more than one team?
ITEM4.A: No, you must be associated with only one team to ensure fairness and proper effort allocation.

ITEM5.Q: What is the duration of the hackathon?
ITEM5.A: The hackathon lasts two to three consecutive days including workshops and mentoring sessions.

ITEM6.Q: Where will the hackathon take place?
ITEM6.A: The hackathon is held in person at an announced venue. Some activities may be available online.

ITEM7.Q: Do all team members need to attend?
ITEM7.A: It is preferable that all team members attend for efficient progress. At minimum, the leader and a technical member should attend.

CONTACT.SUBTITLE: We'd love to hear from you — send us a message and we'll get back soon.
